# Hockey Data

```{r}
library(tidyverse)

# 1. Create the data manually (simple & safe)
mcdavid_goals <- tibble(
  Season = c("2018-19", "2019-20", "2020-21", "2021-22", "2022-23", "2023-24"),
  Goals  = c(41,       34,       33,       44,       64,       32)
)

# 2. Make the plot
plot <- ggplot(mcdavid_goals, aes(x = Season, y = Goals)) +
  # The Bars
  geom_col(fill = "#FF4C00", width = 0.7) +  # Bright Oilers Orange
  
  # The Labels on top of bars
  geom_text(aes(label = Goals), vjust = -0.5, fontface = "bold", size = 5) +
  
  # The Cool Minimal Look
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    title = "Connor McDavid: Goals per Season",
    subtitle = "The road to 64 goals and back",
    x = "",
    y = ""
  ) +
  theme(
    plot.title    = element_text(face = "bold", size = 16),
    axis.text.y   = element_blank(),    # Hide y-axis numbers (cleaner)
    panel.grid    = element_blank(),    # Remove grid lines
    axis.text.x   = element_text(size = 11, face = "bold")
  )

# 3. Show it
print(plot)
```
